title: Syntax error on Node 6, (Node 8 is ok)

body: Closing, lmk if you are having trouble with this and I will re-open.

@cgewecke 
```
nvm install v6.12.2
v6.12.2 is already installed.
Now using node v6.12.2 (npm v3.10.10)
```

```
/usr/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/cli.bundled.js:60353
!function(e,a){ true?module.exports=a():"function"==typeof define&&define.amd?define("ganache",[],a):"object"==typeof exports?exports.ganache=a():e.ganache=a()}(global,function(){return function(e){var a={};function t(c){if(a[c])return a[c].exports;var n=a[c]={i:c,l:!1,exports:{}};return e[c].call(n.exports,n,n.exports,t),n.l=!0,n.exports}return t.m=e,t.c=a,t.d=function(e,a,c){t.o(e,a)||Object.defineProperty(e,a,{configurable:!1,enumerable:!0,get:c})},t.r=function(e){Object.defineProperty(e,"__esModule",{value:!0})},t.n=function(e){var a=e&&e.__esModule?function(){return e.default}:function(){return e};return t.d(a,"a",a),a},t.o=function(e,a){return Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(e,a)},t.p="",t.w={},t(t.s=1036)}([function(e,a,t){try{var c=t(1);if("function"!=typeof c.inherits)throw"";e.exports=c.inherits}catch(a){e.exports=t(1021)}},function(e,a){e.exports=__webpack_require__(3)},function(e,a,t){"use strict";var c="function"==typeof Symbol&&"sym

SyntaxError: Unexpected identifier
    at createScript (vm.js:56:10)
    at Object.runInThisContext (vm.js:97:10)
    at Module._compile (module.js:542:28)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:579:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:487:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:446:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:438:3)
    at Module.runMain (module.js:604:10)
    at run (bootstrap_node.js:383:7)
    at startup (bootstrap_node.js:149:9)
```

@etsangsplk Thanks!

+ Which the command are you running? 
+ If you `nvm use 8`, does that work? 
+ What is your truffle version?

Trying to identify what's going wrong here . . .

@etsangsplk Which truffle version are you using? Your error doesn't have a detailed stack trace so it's hard to tell where the problem is. If you're using a newer version of Truffle you should have a non-webpacked trace.
@etsangsplk Also: which command are you running?

It just show up right from the start 
truffle 
that is it
```
Truffle v4.1.11 (core: 4.1.11)
Solidity v0.4.24 (solc-js)
```
@etsangsplk Yes - we've identified the problem and we're going to try fix it. We updated a dependency that uses newer JS syntax and we have to bump it down.

@etsangsplk what are the constraints that force Node 6 for you?

For Truffle v5, we are currently planning to drop support for Node 6, but I'd like to know more about why users might be constrained. Node 8 is now LTS, mind you.
Using truffle as api. Node version released with internal project is pinned to that node 6.  There is nothing I can do about that part.
@etsangsplk This should be fixed in `4.1.13`. Please ping if you continue have problems with it.
Looks like you are using async which is not available in node6?

@etsangsplk Are you still seeing this error in `4.1.13`?  We downgraded the dependency that used async (in one of its dependencies) and now have Truffle's unit tests running against Node 6 in CI where it seems to be [passing](https://travis-ci.org/trufflesuite/truffle/builds/397482993).

```Truffle v4.1.13 (core: 4.1.13)
Solidity v0.4.24 (solc-js)
 truffle test
/home//Projects/-di/packages/_app_di/node_modules/eth-block-tracker/src/index.js:38

       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

@etsangsplk I need a reproduction case because locally I see this:
```shell
code cgewecke$ mkdir metacoin
code cgewecke$ cd metacoin
metacoin cgewecke$ nvm use 6
Now using node v6.14.3 (npm v3.10.10)
Users-MacBook-Air:metacoin cgewecke$ truffle version
Truffle v4.1.13 (core: 4.1.13)   # <-- Which truffle version are you using?
Solidity v0.4.24 (solc-js)
metacoin cgewecke$ truffle unbox metacoin
Downloading...
Unpacking...
Setting up...
Unbox successful. Sweet!

Commands:

  Compile contracts: truffle compile
  Migrate contracts: truffle migrate
  Test contracts:    truffle test
metacoin cgewecke$ truffle test
Compiling ./contracts/ConvertLib.sol...
Compiling ./contracts/MetaCoin.sol...
Compiling ./contracts/Migrations.sol...
Compiling ./test/TestMetacoin.sol...
Compiling truffle/Assert.sol...
Compiling truffle/DeployedAddresses.sol...


  TestMetacoin
    ✓ testInitialBalanceUsingDeployedContract (80ms)
    ✓ testInitialBalanceWithNewMetaCoin (60ms)

  Contract: MetaCoin
    ✓ should put 10000 MetaCoin in the first account
    ✓ should call a function that depends on a linked library (51ms)
    ✓ should send coin correctly (109ms)


  5 passing (1s)

metacoin cgewecke$ 
```
@etsangsplk If you are running `ganache-cli` separately, you will need to downgrade to `6.1.0-beta.4`

Doubt if any of those tests are hitting the other libraries like eth-block-tracker.
For example for yarn.lock, these libraries are all using async
```
https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/blob/62e1554d86ccb91b861e494e790a67251c77d494/yarn.lock#L3453
```
@etsangsplk What's your crash?

The crash is from node_modules/eth-block-tracker, which is using async feature (same version as in the repro yarn lock).

Tried addin the following on babelrc but does not seem to help, to make node6 recognised asyn/await feature.
```
  "plugins": ["transform-async-to-generator",
  ["transform-runtime", {
      "polyfill": false,
      "regenerator": true
    }]
  ]
```

```
nvm ls

->      v6.12.2

```

```
Truffle v4.1.13 (core: 4.1.13)
Solidity v0.4.24 (solc-js)

truffle test

Keccak bindings are not compiled. Pure JS implementation will be used.
/src/main/resources/bin/node_modules/eth-block-tracker/src/index.js:38
  async awaitCurrentBlock () {
        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

SyntaxError: Unexpected identifier
    at createScript (vm.js:56:10)
    at Object.runInThisContext (vm.js:97:10)
    at Module._compile (module.js:542:28)
    at Module._extensions..js (module.js:579:10)

    at Module.require (module.js:497:17)

    at Module._compile (module.js:570:32)

    at Module.load (module.js:487:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:446:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:438:3
```

It looks like it might be coming from `hd-wallet-provider`? 
```
at require (internal/module.js:20:19)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/src/main/resources/bin/node_modules/truffle-hdwallet-provider/index.js:3:22)
    at Module._compile (module.js:570:32)
```
Could you try the following:
+ Make sure your providers are wrapped in a function closure in your config as shown in the docs [here](https://truffleframework.com/docs/advanced/configuration#providers). This will stop them from automatically loading when truffle pulls the config in.
+ Pin `truffle-hd-walletprovider` to `0.0.3`, which should be Node 6 safe. (We had to upgrade that recently because `npm audit` was throwing security warnings, and it's a wallet).

@cgewecke 

this solves it: truffle-hd-walletprovider to 0.0.3, and it looks like both truffle test and code coverge is working

Just for your record, if other people ask the same thing, this is what i have now:
     "truffle-hdwallet-provider": "0.0.3",
    "ganache-cli": "6.1.0-beta.4",
    "solidity-coverage": "^0.5.0",
    "ethereumjs-testrpc": "^6.0.3"
Fantastic, thank you @etsangsplk.
